oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Union soldier John L. LaRue
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from John L. LaRue, of the 6th Regt. East Tennessee Volunteers Co. G, to his sister E. C. LaRue in the late stages of the Atlanta campaign from Altoona, GA. E. C. LaRue was the great grandmother of donor. He writes: "I suppose Joe Johnson (sic) had some Business at Atlanta and Genneral Sherman is going down in a day or so to settle the Business up for him." Reports on losses in his East Tennessee Unionist regiment.
